explanation: The agent is correct. The statement ‘‘(void) upload_size;’’ evaluates an expression that has no side effects and contributes nothing to program behaviour; removing it would not change the observable behaviour of the program. Per MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2, any executed operation whose removal would not affect program behaviour is dead code, so this cast-to-void is dead code. (If the parameter were volatile or its evaluation had side effects the situation would differ, but that is not the case here.) To comply, eliminate the no-op (or omit the parameter identifier in the function definition or use an approved mechanism for indicating intentionally unused parameters.)
